title: You know what would make the game more engaging? Daily quests.
body:
And before anyone points this out, yes this is a direct reference to Heroes of the Storm, but you know what? It works. Every day that I'm not too busy I'll play a couple of games of HotS for the nice bonus gold, I really wish I had an incentive to play a few games of League every day. Usually I just sit around dreading the concept of Solo queue too much to jump in, and it isn't until some new content suddenly comes out or all of my friends are online that I get back into League.

Besides, we've been needing IP gain buffs for a while.

8. Buy milk

Better objects would be like, play a support champion for 3 games. Win 2 games of 3v3. Consider playing dominion.

I don't like the idea. It's one of the main reasons I stopped playing HOTS.

Daily quests are like chores. They become to consume you and kinda force you to play just for the sake of gaining a little boost towards your next champion. Games are about you deciding when to play them, and the main reward is fun not virtual currency.

In addition, they make players, who can't finish them, feel like they missed out on something or "failed to accomplish" something. That's not a good morale boost for a competitive game like this. Look at what's up with Hearthstone. They have a lot of quests that ask you to win to gain reward, but with limited amount of good cards for new players, it is freaking hard to do that. You have to go through 5 losses to some rich-ass legendary card collector to get a single win. That's really frustrating.

The best way to reward people, is to do so without forcing them to play, and the reward must not be known.
I played DOTA2 starting from beta and I loved the way they rewarded a cosmetic item every time you leveled up account. The beauty of that was the fact that you are not forced into a time frame of when you accomplish this, and the reward that you'd get was not known to you. It might've been common or an legendary, or even arcana......you never knew. It wasn't like a job you had to do to get paid. It was just a gift for spending your time having fun (or raging, in some cases).

Overall, I think it would be a bad idea, and I am fully against such "rewards". Seeing as I recently just started this game, it would be sad if I had to leave it for the same reason that I left HOTS.

Too anyone who doesn't know, HoT offers I believe 100~ gold per daily quest, sometimes more sometimes less, and the regular gold gains per game?  20 if you lose, 30 if you win.

Of course, that's without me telling you that heroes cost, at most, 10000 gold.  Unless they're new, then they cost 15000 gold.

Yes, there is a smaller price, it goes 2000, 4000, 7000, and then 10000.  Still, that's many days until you can get a low cost hero.

There ARE other ways to get gold, playing 1 hero and leveling their mastery points a lot will give you gold, more than a daily quest, but that's a different matter.

All in all, HoT would give close to nothing WITHOUT daily quests, League of Legends stills gives more IP without the system.

Would have to be obtainable in bot games

Forcing players to pick certain champs can screw up an otherwise good & well-thought out team comp. Imagine 5 players all scrambling to meet prerequisites for rewards, but having a crappy comp.

In bot games, you get less anyway. There'd be no point in letting it be in bot games.

That said, unlike HotS, it could never be _only_ Demacians or _only_ Ionians. 
They'd have to do two city-states at a time, so that the team can be balanced.

Even then, in Hots it's usually only one or two games. So later in the day you won't have a whole team scrambling to be those champs.

HotS also takes way less time to finish 1 game. First I have to force myself to play (as an example) a Yordle champ, then I have to play for 35-55 minutes (average time) while also dealing with whatever fortune throws my way (afks, disconnects, never connects, ragers, tilters/feeders).

Put it in co-op mode, same as HotS. Easy peesy push mid to win 10-15 min games.
Of course, they'd have to leave in the ability for both teams to surrender.

This.  As a mainly co-op player I'm constantly frustrated when events keep forcing me into PvP to get rewards when I don't really feel like queuing up with a bunch of people I don't know.  Remember, even if only 5% of the playerbase is toxic that means you're going to see one of them roughly 40% of the time.  I choose to play co-op so I can ignore them, but every time another reward comes out that involves playing dozens of PvP matches it makes me feel like I'm missing something by playing the way I enjoy.  A sentiment that, interestingly, applies to the whole 'daily quest' system as a whole.
Unfortunately, the number of people who only play bots is limited to people who aren't allowed to play PvP yet, and about .5% of the rest of us.

Still, if quests are a thing, at least most of them should be allowed in co-op. Even on my main account (level 30, S2 ranked, 600+ pvp games) I can reliably queue up and near instantaneously find a game.

I can understand something being pvp-only if it has to do with getting multi-kills or having a spree in general, but even then I would only have 1 pvp exclusive quest at a time.

I feel like the Daily Win currently in place is the only way to keep things from getting complicated.

Let's say there's a daily quest to get 15 kills (maybe even in 1 game), you're going to have people delaying games so that their tank/jungler/support can get their kills. Let alone that people are going to queue up for carry roles more than usual on those days, meaning people in team builder would wait even longer to find supports, and the few ones you do find will be Zed, Cass, or Brand.

Win the Freljord/Ultimate Hunt events. Now your team's Ashe is focusing the enemy Sejuani in teamfights, your assassin chooses to go over the free kill on the enemy adc to try and get their assassin. Also bear in mind that people will be more likely playing champs (or roles) they're not comfortable with, increasing the chances of the player doing poorly and getting flamed because their team, which might want nothing to with the quest, also get burdened.

The only way people can be incentivized to play, without risking people intentionally playing sub-optimally, would be to tell them to win. Even that runs the risk however of increasing toxicity, people leaving queues if people play non-meta champions, flaming people for doing poorly, people playing more games than they want to simply for the reward.

If Riot did want to experiment with and expand upon the idea, the way that I see raising the fewest problems would be giving each map it's own Daily Win. People would play The Crystal Scar and Twisted Treeline more, increasing fervor for those modes and compelling Riot to keep a closer eye on the balance of those modes (to their probable dismay). It still does run the risk of increasing toxicity as mentioned before, but I've seen no alternative with more preferable consequences.
